snippet: The defection of the diplomat, Nawaf Fares, if confirmed, would make him the second prominent Syrian to abandon President Bashar al-Assad in less than a week.
abstract: Kofi Annan asks the United Nations Security Council to threaten the Syrian government and the rebels with consequences for failure to comply with his peace plan; the request comes as new evidence emerges of fracturing in the government of President Bashar al-Assad of Syria, which has faced a slow but growing rash of defections and desertions.

byline.contributor: Andrew Roth contributed reporting from Moscow, and Dalal Mawad and Neil MacFarquhar from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: The defection of the diplomat, Nawaf Fares, if confirmed, would make him the second prominent Syrian to abandon President Bashar al-Assad in less than a week.

headline.seo: Annan Seeks More U.N. Pressure on Syria
headline.main: Syria’s Ambassador to Iraq Reported to Defect
headline.print_headline: Annan Seeks More U.N. Pressure as One of Syria’s Ambassadors Defects
